Description: Painted pottery female shabti of Tameket with a black braided lappet-wig, a white modelled face(worn and damaged) with black and white eyes, a red and black collar covering the crossed arms in relief and enclosing the brown hands outlined with black that hold a red hoe and the string of the seed-basket that hangs over the shoulder; the body is white; the front of the leg section is inscribed with a column of black painted hieroglyphs flanked by red lines.
Condition: fair - section missing from the face, damage to the foot
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
